title: A Practical Guide to Vanilla Web Components
subtitle: Presented by Leon Revill for Pluralsight
description: Web Components are set to change how you build front-end web applications. This course teaches you how to use the Web Components specifications to create encapsulated and reusable UI components which can be used with almost any framework or library.
author: Adam Reed

title: WebAssembly: The Big Picture
subtitle: Presented by Barry Luijbregts for Pluralsight
description: WebAssembly could revolutionize the web. In this course, you’ll learn what it is and why it is important. You’ll learn what creating applications with WebAssembly looks like, and how you can use it to create web applications using languages like C#.
author: Adam Reed

title: Using HttpClient to Consume APIs in .NET
subtitle: Presented by Kevin Dockx for Pluralsight
description: This course will teach you how to consume APIs with HttpClient in .NET.
author: Adam Reed

title: .NET 6 First Look
subtitle: Presented by Gill Cleeren for Pluralsight
description: .NET 6.0 comes packed with changes. Alongside, Visual Studio 2022 will be released in parallel. This course will teach you what you can expect in this latest iteration of the platform and its IDE.
author: Adam Reed

title: C# 10: The Big Picture
subtitle: Presented by Mike Woodring for Pluralsight
description: C# is one of the most popular programming languages in the world. This course will teach you core concepts critical to evaluating whether C# is the right language for you, and will prepare you to kick start your learning journey to C# mastery.
author: Adam Reed

title: OWASP Top 10: API Security Playbook
subtitle: Presented by Gavin Johnson-Lynn for Pluralsight
description: APIs are crucial to the internet and their security is vital to both their creators and consumers. This course will teach you about each of the OWASP API Top 10 vulnerabilities, helping you to identify and prevent them in your APIs.
author: Adam Reed

title: Learn to Program with C++ 17
subtitle: Presented by Kate Gregory for Pluralsight
description: If you've never programmed before, and you think you'd like to learn C++, why not learn it first? This course covers what you need to start writing real applications in C++.
author: Adam Reed

title: TypeScript Fundamentals
subtitle: Presented by Dan Wahlin, John Papa for Pluralsight
description: This course will teach you the key concepts and features needed to get started with TypeScript and use it to build large (and small) scale applications.
author: Adam Reed
